title: Authors and Citation
text: Aparicio J (2024). exploreHTP: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {exploreHTP: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data},   author = {Johan Aparicio},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data
text: exploreHTP designed assist researchers plant breeders efficiently exploring analyzing data derived drone imagery. package offers suite tools tailored unique needs plant breeding data, facilitating comprehensive data exploration, correlation analysis, data manipulation. Key functionalities include: Data Exploration: Simplified methods visualizing manipulating large datasets high throughput phenotyping. Correlation Analysis: Tools calculate correlations different traits across multiple time points, providing insights trait relationships temporal dynamics. Modeling Canopy Evolution: Advanced functionalities modeling predicting canopy growth development time.

title: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data
text: can install development version exploreHTP GitHub :

title: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data
text: basic example shows use exploreHTP:
code: library(exploreHTP) data(dt_potato) dt_potato <- dt_potato  results <- read_HTP(   data = dt_potato,   genotype = "Gen",   time = "DAP",   plot = "Plot",   traits = c("Canopy", "PH"),   row = "Row",   range = "Range" ) names(results) #> [1] "summ_traits"      "exp_design_resum" "locals_min_max"   "dt_long" head(results$summ_traits)

title: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data
code: # Trait by Time table <- plot(results, label_size = 4, signif = TRUE, n_row = 1) head(table)

title: Explore High-Throughput Phenotypic (HTP) Data
code: # Time by Trait table <- plot(results, type = "time_by_trait", label_size = 4, signif = TRUE) head(table)

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_HTP
text: Canopy Modelling

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_HTP
code: canopy_HTP(   results,   canopy = "Canopy",   plot_id = NULL,   correct_max = TRUE,   add_zero = TRUE,   return_method = FALSE,   method = c("subplex", "pracmanm", "anms") )

title: Canopy Modelling — canopy_HTP
text: results Object class exploreHTP canopy string plot_id Optional Plot ID. NULL default correct_max Add maximum value reaching local maximum. TRUE default. add_zero TRUE FALSE. Add zero time series.TRUE default. return_method TRUE FALSE. return method selected optimization table. FALSE default. method vector methods used, character string. See optimx package. c("subplex", "pracmanm", "anms") default.

text: tibble 1372 rows 17 variables: Trial chr trial name DAP dbl denoting Days planting Plot dbl denoting unique plot id Row dbl denoting row coordinate Range dbl denoting range coordinate Gen chr denoting genotype id Yield dbl Total Yield measured end season VineMaturity dbl VineMaturity measure season Red - Canopy dbl denoting drone-derived traits

title: Plot an object of class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
code: # S3 method for read_HTP plot(   x,   type = "trait_by_time",   label_size = 4,   signif = FALSE,   method = "pearson",   n_row = NULL,   n_col = NULL,   ... )

title: Plot an object of class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
text: x object inheriting class read_HTP resulting executing function read_HTP() type Character string "trait_by_time" "time_by_trait". label_size Label size. 4 default. signif TRUE FALSE. Add pvalue correlations plot. method method="pearson" default value. alternatives passed cor "spearman" "kendall". last two much slower, particularly big data sets. n_row Number rows use face_wrap(). NULL default. n_col Number columns use face_wrap(). NULL default. ... graphical parameters. future improvements.

title: Plot an object of class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
text: ggplot object invisible data.frame

title: Plot an object of class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
text: Johan Aparicio [aut]

title: Plot an object of class read_HTP — plot.read_HTP
code: library(exploreHTP) data(dt_potato) dt_potato <- dt_potato results <- read_HTP(   data = dt_potato,   genotype = "Gen",   time = "DAP",   plot = "Plot",   traits = c("Canopy", "PH"),   row = "Row",   range = "Range" ) table <- plot(results, label_size = 4, signif = TRUE, n_row = 2)  table #> # A tibble: 7 × 7 #>    time col    row    corr  p.value     n signi #>   <dbl> <fct>  <fct> <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl> <fct> #> 1    36 Canopy PH     0.47 7.78e-11   176 ***   #> 2    42 Canopy PH     0.67 4.50e-27   196 ***   #> 3    56 Canopy PH    -0.18 1.16e- 2   196 *     #> 4    76 Canopy PH     0.31 8.89e- 6   196 ***   #> 5    92 Canopy PH     0.27 1.32e- 4   196 ***   #> 6   100 Canopy PH     0.31 1.38e- 5   196 ***   #> 7   108 Canopy PH     0.07 3.37e- 1   196 ns    plot(results, type = "time_by_trait", label_size = 4, signif = TRUE)

title: Read HTP data — read_HTP
text: Read HTP data

title: Read HTP data — read_HTP
code: read_HTP(data, genotype, time, plot, traits, row, range)

title: Read HTP data — read_HTP
text: data data.frame wide format. genotype character string indicating column data contains genotypes. time character string indicating column data contains time points. plot character string indicating column data contains plot IDs. traits character vector specifying traits models fitted. row character string indicating column data contains row coordinates. range character string indicating column data contains range coordinates.

title: Read HTP data — read_HTP
text: object class read_HTP, list : summ_traits data.frame containing summary traits. exp_design_resum data.frame containing summary experimental  design. locals_min_max data.frame containing local maximums minimuns dt_long data.frame long format.

title: Read HTP data — read_HTP
code: library(exploreHTP) data(dt_potato) dt_potato <- dt_potato results <- read_HTP(   data = dt_potato,   genotype = "Gen",   time = "DAP",   plot = "Plot",   traits = c("Canopy", "PH"),   row = "Row",   range = "Range" ) names(results) #> [1] "summ_traits"      "exp_design_resum" "locals_min_max"   "dt_long"           head(results$summ_traits) #> # A tibble: 6 × 12 #>   trait   time    Min  Mean Median   Max    SD       CV     n  miss `miss%` #>   <chr>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> <int> <int>   <dbl> #> 1 Canopy    29  0      0      0      0    0    NaN        196     0       0 #> 2 Canopy    36  0      2.86   1.77  14.5  3.12   1.09     196     0       0 #> 3 Canopy    42  0.731 22.7   22.3   44.1  9.00   0.397    196     0       0 #> 4 Canopy    56 32.8   74.0   73.7   99.2 12.2    0.165    196     0       0 #> 5 Canopy    76 89.6   99.7  100    100    1.05   0.0105   196     0       0 #> 6 Canopy    92 63.1   97.1   98.5  100.   4.24   0.0436   196     0       0 #> # ℹ 1 more variable: `neg%` <dbl>
